oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of Confederate veteran William Rawleigh Campbell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From Haywood County, Tenn., Pvt. William Campbell served in Co. D, 8th Ark. Inf., CSA. Campbell fought at Shiloh, Perryville and Murfreesboro, and was wounded at both Chickamauga and Atlanta. His foot was "entirely shot off" in the first charge at the Battle of Franklin in 1864. He was a prisoner in Nashville, then Camp Chase, Ohio, and later paroled at Vicksburg, Miss. He settled in Haywood County after the war and was active in the United Confederate Veterans.
